<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning </strong>and shoutout to all readers commemorating their Height Day today (5/9). Cherish it, because the people celebrating over the next few days will likely end up more successful. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Moving right along...Saturdays in the coronavirus era mean another edition of the Brew’s New Normal series, where we explore the long-term effects of COVID-19 on one particular topic or industry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the first edition, we looked at the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/24/future-cities" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">future of cities</a>. Last week, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/whats-next-big-tech" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Big Tech</a> took center stage. Today, we're focusing on gaming and virtual worlds. </p>

The unemployment rate </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/623da121a91a4951b3bcde201a46120d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit 14.7%</a></span><span> (the highest since the Great Depression) and 20.5 million jobs were lost. The job market has collapsed with stunning speed—in February, the unemployment rate was 3.5%.</span>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VIRTUAL WORLDS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/covid19-speeds-formation-metaverse?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A World Gone Virtual
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Virtual world" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84ODIvdmlydHVhbF93b3JsZC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Day #600 of lockdown, it’s become clear that Jim Halpert’s fourth-wall-breaking eye contact isn’t enough social connection to sustain us. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One solution:</strong> The metaverse, virtual worlds, the digital "third-place"...<em>whatever</em> you want to call it when you and your friends’ avatars hang out online. The cheapest ticket to get there is a game and/or console, and COVID-19 has poured jet fuel on growth.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Games:</strong></span><span> </span><span><em>Animal Crossing: New Horizons'</em></span><span> three-day sales </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/7/21250285/nintendo-earnings-switch-sales-q4-2020-animal-crossing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set a Nintendo record</a></span><span>, Roblox </span><span><a href="https://www.voguebusiness.com/technology/digital-fashion-surges-in-a-sales-downturn-forma-drest?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">usage surged</a></span><span> 40% in March, and 350 million registered </span><span><em>Fortnite</em></span><span> players logged </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/06/fortnite-adds-100-million-players-one-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3.2 billion hours</a></span><span> last month.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Consoles: </strong></span><span>Nintendo sold a </span><span><a href="https://venturebeat.com/2020/04/21/nintendo-switch-sales-march-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record number</a></span><span> of Switches in March, and sales of Sony PS4s and Microsoft Xbox Ones both rose more than 25% over last year, despite all being 3+ years old.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some people are even going full <em>Ready Player One</em>, with Facebook attributing <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/30/21241995/facebook-q1-2020-earnings-oculus-rift-quest-sales-half-life-alyx-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the lion’s share</a> of its non-advertising revenue in Q1 to Oculus virtual reality hardware. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Going virtual is the non-Zoom option</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As COVID-19 shut down social schedules, more people have turned to online games to recreate canceled gatherings, giving us a glimpse of a world reborn in pixels. Here are four in-person events that were converted to immersive virtual spaces this year:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Students from Brown, MIT, Penn, and many more rebuilt their closed college campuses and </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/mit-campus-recreated-in-minecraft-2020-4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roamed the halls</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Parents </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-15/kids-flock-to-roblox-for-parties-and-playdates-during-lockdown?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hosted playdates</a></span><span> and birthday parties for their cooped-up kids.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/av/entertainment-arts-52503611/coronavirus-virtual-marriage-on-animal-crossing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Several</a></span><span> couples </span><span><a href="https://www.polygon.com/2020/4/16/21201443/coronavirus-self-isolation-quarantine-life-events-birthday-parties-roblox-weddings-world-of-warcraft?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tied the knot</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One family held an in-game </span><span><a href="https://www.foxnews.com/tech/coronavirus-victim-funeral-nintendo-animal-crossing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">memorial service</a></span><span> for a gamer who died of the coronavirus.</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While some games (Roblox, <em>Minecraft</em>) were built for this kind of free-flowing donothingness, <em>Fortnite</em> just added a new mode called "Party Royale" to encourage players to spend more unstructured time <a href="https://fortnite.fandom.com/wiki/Emote?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">emoting</a> their way through virtual time and space. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s next?</strong> Even as <em>Fortnite</em> dance moves return to IRL clubs and concerts post-pandemic, COVID-19 has accelerated the creation and widespread use of a virtual shared space. And industries from music to retail won’t miss the opportunity to meet their customers there.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FASHION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/fashion-brands-trying-sell-video-games?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Summer 2020 Collections Coming to a Metaverse Near You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looking cute online used to mean duck faces and Rio filters. But now that video games are our best approximation of socialization, digital avatars have become the hottest new <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/06/fashion/animal-crossing-fashion.html?action=click&module=Features&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">medium of self-expression</a>. And to build the perfect digital outfit on <em>Animal Crossing</em>, more people are turning to the pros. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Designer Sandy Liang recently </span><span><a href="https://www.elle.com/fashion/a32315651/animal-crossing-fashion/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sponsored</a></span><span> an in-game pop-up shop. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>100 Thieves, a gaming/lifestyle brand, </span><span><a href="https://www.dailyesports.gg/100-thieves-releases-apparel-collection-codes-for-animal-crossing/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made</a></span><span> its entire apparel collection available for free.  </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Valentino and Marc Jacobs </span><span><a href="https://adage.com/article/digital/marc-jacobs-and-valentino-bring-luxury-animal-crossing-virtual-outfits/2254941?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shared</a></span><span> outfits with players. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But fashion in gaming goes way beyond <em>Animal Crossing</em>. Moschino <a href="https://www.ea.com/games/the-sims/the-sims-4/news/moschino-collection?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collaborated</a> with <em>The Sims</em>, and <em>Fortnite</em> partnered with Nike on Air Jordan outfits.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The play: </strong>With IRL shopping forever transformed, retailers are looking for ways to get in front of consumers. Some are trying podcasts, Spotify, and Instagram Lives. But getting into gaming can be difficult since many designers aren’t familiar with 3D modeling, a necessary but expensive technique. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>In 2019, digital game spending hit a record $109 billion, according to Nielsen. Fashion brands will be looking to capture a larger slice of that in 2020, when actual clothing matters little. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/animal-crossing-fascinates-financial-analysts?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Meet the Raccoon Dog on the Financial Times Homepage
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Bank of Nook" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/idY1E0XQVMvDnC1l8W/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Bank of Nook" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/idY1E0XQVMvDnC1l8W/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy/Animal Crossing</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to <a href="https://thenextweb.com/hardfork/2020/04/24/animal-crossing-tom-nook-richer-than-jeff-bezos-but-does-this-raccoon-deserve-all-that-wealth/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one study</a>, <em>Animal Crossing: New Horizons</em>' “fearless leader” Tom Nook is 40x richer than Jeff Bezos. But that hasn’t stopped the game’s 12 million players from agreeing to his loan terms. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For all those who <em>aren’t</em> playing, here’s why the game fascinates financial analysts:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Its stalk market (sic) has more hype than a new pair of Yeezys. </strong></span><span>Players purchase turnips on Sundays, and try to sell them </span><span><a href="https://www.polygon.com/2020/4/30/21242653/animal-crossing-new-horizons-turnip-prices-daisy-mae-sell-buy-nintendo-switch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at a profit</a></span><span> before they rot at the end of the week.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Dynamic interest rates reflect real-world shifts. </strong></span><span>The Bank of Nook did its best Jerome Powell impression and cut savings accounts’ interest rates from </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/68f96d24-02f0-42fd-b132-aba0acba777f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">0.5% to 0.05%</a></span><span> in April to encourage more spending and less time-traveling (</span><span><a href="https://www.polygon.com/animal-crossing-new-horizons-switch-acnh-guide/2020/3/20/21168240/time-travel-next-day-tomorrow-faster?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">long story</a></span><span>).</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Players barter for goods and services using the in-game currency, but also their IRL money. </strong></span><span>They haggle for coveted characters, argue over exchange rates on rare tarantulas, and even </span><span><a href="https://www.pocketgamer.com/articles/082932/worlds-first-animal-crossing-interior-design-service-launches-offering-consultants-gbp40-an-hour-to-perfect-in-game-homes/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hire interior designers</a></span><span> to deck out their new homes.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">...a millennial purchasing a house? Not in this economy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The reason so many people are playing out their most mundane financial fantasies in a virtual world is simple: the American Dream is <a href="https://www.newstatesman.com/culture/games/2020/04/comforting-economic-delusions-animal-crossing-quarantine-s-most-popular-game?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still alive</a> in <em>Animal Crossing</em>, where a Japanese racoon dog can’t wait to finance your third bedroom. </p>

</h3>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A lot can happen in 21 months. When we turned 21 months old, we went from sleeping 30 hours a day to walking and knowing more than 50 words (not to brag or anything). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But you’re an adult, so instead you should spend 21 months paying zero interest with <a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/citi-diamond-preferred/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-citidp-05092020-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this balance transfer credit card</a>. And trust us, building credit with this card is way more exciting than toddlers playing with building blocks. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/virtual-concerts-offer-pandemic-alternative-musicians?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Virtual Concerts: Much Shorter Lines for the Bathroom
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last February, EDM producer Marshmello played a concert inside <em>Fortnite,</em> a video game that now has about as many registered players as the U.S. has residents. The choice may have seemed odd at the time, but as <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/2/18208223/fortnite-epic-games-marshmello-concert-exciting-bizarre-future-music?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Verge wrote</a>, “A live concert inside a video game feels like the future.” Now, we’re learning just how prescient that take was. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last month, rapper Travis Scott </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/20/travis-scott-embarks-worldwide-concert-tour-inside-fortnite?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">embarked on</a></span><span> a tour inside </span><span><em>Fortnite</em></span><span>. Before the "Astronomical" event kicked off, </span><span><a href="https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/travis-scott-fortnite-concert-989209/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Rolling Stone reported </a></span><span>streams of Scott’s music jumped 26%, with some especially astro-themed songs (like “Stargazing”) seeing a 50%+ increase.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dillon Francis, Steve Aoki, and deadmau5 followed up last night with an in-game concert called the Party Royale Premiere. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So are virtual concerts the future of live music? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The always-enterprising raver community has tinkered with ad-hoc setups during quarantine, including a rave in the virtual world <em>Second Life</em> that lasted 24 hours.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But, as one VICE reporter </span><span><a href="https://www.vice.com/en_uk/article/n7j8mb/vice-documentary-raving-virtual-reality?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found</a></span><span>, it doesn’t quite replicate the experience...most of us don’t have sweaty strangers in our homes. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Our prediction:</strong> Virtual concerts might develop a niche audience and open up new monetization opportunities, but they won't replace IRL live shows wholesale. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PLATFORMS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/spolight-roblox?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Spotlight: Roblox
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bloxburg " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84ODMvYmxveGJ1cmcucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Roblox</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just a gorgeous afternoon for doing some housework in Bloxburg, a city located within the gaming platform Roblox. Let's learn a bit more about this surging company. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Valuation: </strong>Around $4 billion following its <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/roblox-raises-150-million-in-funding-in-bet-on-metaverse-11582754400?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latest fundraising round</a> in February. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monetization: </strong>Roblox is a platform home to tens of millions of different games. Many of those games are free, so Roblox earns revenue through its virtual currency called Robux. It plans to generate $1 billion in bookings in 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Audience: </strong>Huge, and young. Last year about half of U.S. kids age 9–12 used the platform, per Comscore.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Innovation: </strong>Over 2 million developers are <a href="https://a16z.com/2020/02/26/roblox/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">currently building</a> on the platform.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><iframe style="width: 100% !important; display: block !important;" src="https://amuselabs.com/pmm/crossword?id=02f254c3&set=4cb1580beba08cc1b0f9865dea8cee9b70421a26e196828d0c2b52fbceacd0dd&embed=1" name="4cb1580beba08cc1b0f9865dea8cee9b70421a26e196828d0c2b52fbceacd0dd" width="100%" height="700" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/advertisers-get-creative-video-game-integrations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Advertisers: How Do You Do, Fellow Kids?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While marketing budgets are usually the first casualty of economic downturns, advertisers are circling video games like Pac-Man ghosts. Facebook noted that video games as a category showed “relative strength” despite a broader decline in ad spend. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That's because digital universes, like the ones in <em>Fortnite</em> and <em>Animal Crossing</em>, offer advertisers the chance to play in a world where physical infrastructure doesn't constrain creativity.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Thinking big: </strong></span><span>In his </span><span><em>Fortnite </em></span><span>concert, rapper Travis Scott’s </span><span><a href="https://www.vox.com/culture/2020/4/24/21235196/travis-scott-fortnite-concert-livestream-the-scotts-music-video?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gigantic</a></span><span> avatar wore his signature Nike shoes in front of more than 12.3 million concurrent viewers, offering brand exposure on a scale difficult to replicate in real life. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Denny’s has entered the chat</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marketers go wherever the eyeballs are, and since the widespread lockdowns began...the eyeballs are turned toward video games—in just two weeks in March, the streaming site Twitch reported a <a href="https://www.tubefilter.com/2020/03/26/youtube-twitch-facebook-instagram-views-increasing-coronavirus-data/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">31% increase</a> in viewership. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>If you’ve traded virtual turnips recently with someone named Dennys247, then you were actually conducting business with the diner chain. Denny’s has been playing </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/angelictactics/status/1247962720944533504?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Animal Crossing</em></a></span><span> and </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/DennysDiner/status/1252673527536390144?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Call of Duty</em></a></span><span>, passing out discounts to some gamers it connects with.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> While brands might see digital worlds as a <em>tabula rasa</em> to be filled with promotions, players are hypersensitive to inauthenticity—they want frictionless integrations that enhance gameplay, not disrupt it. “You’re not just dumping content on the audience, they’re participating with you,” Twitch’s Nathan Lindberg <a href="https://www.admonsters.com/esports-changing-advertising-game/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a> to AdMonsters.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How to Get More Brew
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Say you fit into this demographic—you enjoy the Brew's daily updates throughout the week, but your Sundays are kind of lacking in the "intellectual stimulation" department. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We might just have the solution: Light Roast, our premium Sunday newsletter. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's in Light Roast: </strong>One big story, links to 10 of the most fascinating stories from the week, and Q&As with our writers. It’s like the regular Brew, but in sweatpants.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How you can get Light Roast: </strong>Refer 3 people to the Brew using your unique link. That’s it. Hit 3 referrals today, and you’ll get Light Roast in your inbox tomorrow morning. </p>

</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend conversation starters...</strong>for when you make a new friend at a <em>Fortnite</em> concert:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Without new content to post, is Instagram becoming more like Facebook? Seeing a lot more 1) birthday posts and 2) throwbacks</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Which event at the </span><span><a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@alexpresley_?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Quarantine Olympics</a></span><span> would you dominate?</span>

</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Want to learn more about the future of media?</strong> Read Matthew Ball's <a href="https://www.matthewball.vc/all?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collection of essays</a> on topics like cloud gaming, the next frontier of storytelling, and yes, the so-called "<a href="https://www.matthewball.vc/all/themetaverse?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">metaverse</a>." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Speaking of the</strong> <strong style="color:#000">future...</strong>whether it’s your first time diving in the virtual deep end, or you’re already preparing your email rebuttal to this newsletter, you should sign up for Emerging Tech Brew, our tri-weekly newsletter on digital trends and other emerging tech news. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=emtech&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While mega-events like SXSW and the Olympics have been canceled or postponed due to the coronavirus, some lesser known gatherings have met a similar fate. </li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Portland changes </span><span><a href="https://www.foxnews.com/travel/portland-world-naked-bike-ride-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">World Naked Bike Ride</a></span><span> event due to coronavirus, still encourages people to bike naked"</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"It's official: </span><span><a href="https://www.apg-wi.com/spooner_advocate/free/its-official-lumberjack-world-championships-is-canceled-this-summer/article_229a42ca-8f1f-11ea-92b4-ebfbbf1e0a78.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lumberjack World Championships</a></span><span> is canceled this summer"</span>

style=\"color:#000\"\u003eConsoles: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNintendo sold a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord number\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of Switches in March, and sales of Sony PS4s and Microsoft Xbox Ones both rose more than 25% over last year, despite all being 3+ years old.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome people are even style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe lion’s share\u003c/a\u003e of its non-advertising revenue in Q1 to Oculus virtual reality style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs COVID-19 shut down social schedules, more people have turned to online games to recreate canceled gatherings, giving us a glimpse of a world reborn in pixels. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eStudents from Brown, MIT, Penn, and many more rebuilt their closed college campuses and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etied the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/tech/coronavirus-victim-funeral-nintendo-animal-crossing?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" \u003cem\u003eMinecraft\u003c/em\u003e) were built for this kind of free-flowing donothingness, \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e just added a new mode called \"Party Royale\" to encourage players to spend more unstructured time \u003ca href=\"https://fortnite.fandom.com/wiki/Emote?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLooking cute online used to mean duck faces and Rio filters. But now that video games are our best approximation of socialization, digital avatars have become the hottest new \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/06/fashion/animal-crossing-fashion.html?action=click\u0026amp;module=Features\u0026amp;pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emedium of self-expression\u003c/a\u003e. And to build the perfect digital outfit on \u003cem\u003eAnimal Crossing\u003c/em\u003e, more people are turning to the pros. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDesigner Sandy Liang recently \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.elle.com/fashion/a32315651/animal-crossing-fashion/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esponsored\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e an in-game pop-up shop. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e100 Thieves, a gaming/lifestyle brand, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.dailyesports.gg/100-thieves-releases-apparel-collection-codes-for-animal-crossing/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its entire apparel collection available for free.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eValentino and Marc Jacobs \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://adage.com/article/digital/marc-jacobs-and-valentino-bring-luxury-animal-crossing-virtual-outfits/2254941?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshared\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e outfits with players. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut fashion in gaming goes way beyond \u003cem\u003eAnimal Crossing\u003c/em\u003e. Moschino \u003ca href=\"https://www.ea.com/games/the-sims/the-sims-4/news/moschino-collection?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollaborated\u003c/a\u003e with \u003cem\u003eThe Sims\u003c/em\u003e, and \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e partnered with Nike on Air Jordan outfits.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe play: \u003c/strong\u003eWith IRL shopping forever transformed, retailers are looking for ways to get in front of consumers. Some are trying podcasts, Spotify, and Instagram Lives. But getting into gaming can be difficult since many designers aren’t familiar with 3D modeling, a necessary but expensive technique. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2019, digital game spending hit a record $109 billion, according to Nielsen. Fashion brands will be looking to capture a larger slice of that in 2020, when actual clothing matters little. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast February, EDM producer Marshmello played a concert inside \u003cem\u003eFortnite,\u003c/em\u003e a video game that now has about as many registered players as the U.S. has residents. The choice may have seemed odd at the time, but as \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/2/18208223/fortnite-epic-games-marshmello-concert-exciting-bizarre-future-music?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Verge wrote\u003c/a\u003e, “A live concert inside a video game feels like the future.” Now, we’re learning just how prescient that take was. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast month, rapper Travis Scott \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/20/travis-scott-embarks-worldwide-concert-tour-inside-fortnite?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eembarked on\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a tour inside \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Before the \"Astronomical\" event kicked off, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/travis-scott-fortnite-concert-989209/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRolling Stone reported \u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003estreams of Scott’s music jumped 26%, with some especially astro-themed songs (like “Stargazing”) seeing a 50%+ increase.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDillon Francis, Steve Aoki, and deadmau5 followed up last night with an in-game concert called the Party Royale Premiere. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo are virtual concerts the future of live music? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe always-enterprising raver community has tinkered with ad-hoc setups during quarantine, including a rave in the virtual world \u003cem\u003eSecond Life\u003c/em\u003e that lasted 24 hours.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut, as one VICE reporter \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en_uk/article/n7j8mb/vice-documentary-raving-virtual-reality?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efound\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, it doesn’t quite replicate the experience...most of us don’t have sweaty strangers in our homes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOur prediction:\u003c/strong\u003e Virtual concerts might develop a niche audience and open up new monetization opportunities, but they won't replace IRL live shows wholesale. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- Many of those games are free, so Roblox earns revenue through its virtual currency called Robux. It plans to generate $1 billion in bookings in 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAudience: \u003c/strong\u003eHuge, and young. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile marketing budgets are usually the first casualty of economic downturns, advertisers are circling video games like Pac-Man ghosts. Facebook noted that video games as a category showed “relative strength” despite a broader decline in ad spend. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat's because digital universes, like the ones in \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003eAnimal Crossing\u003c/em\u003e, offer advertisers the chance to play in a world where physical infrastructure doesn't constrain creativity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThinking big: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn his \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003econcert, rapper Travis Scott’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/culture/2020/4/24/21235196/travis-scott-fortnite-concert-livestream-the-scotts-music-video?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egigantic\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e avatar wore his signature Nike shoes in front of more than 12.3 million concurrent viewers, offering brand exposure on a scale difficult to replicate in real life. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eDenny’s has entered the chat\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMarketers go wherever the eyeballs are, and since the widespread lockdowns began...the eyeballs are turned toward video games—in just two weeks in March, the streaming site Twitch reported a \u003ca href=\"https://www.tubefilter.com/2020/03/26/youtube-twitch-facebook-instagram-views-increasing-coronavirus-data/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e31% increase\u003c/a\u003e in viewership. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIf you’ve traded virtual turnips recently with someone named Dennys247, then you were actually conducting business with the diner chain. Denny’s has been playing \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/angelictactics/status/1247962720944533504?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAnimal Crossing\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/DennysDiner/status/1252673527536390144?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eCall of Duty\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, passing out discounts to some gamers it connects with.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e While brands might see digital worlds as a \u003cem\u003etabula rasa\u003c/em\u003e to be filled with promotions, players are hypersensitive to inauthenticity—they want frictionless integrations that enhance gameplay, not disrupt it. “You’re not just dumping content on the audience, they’re participating with you,” Twitch’s Nathan Lindberg \u003ca
